receiving.title: DSD Receiving (Direct Store Delivery)
receiving.notes: Menu: 4 › Goods Receipt › 1. DSD Receipt (with Reference). Keep invoices tidy. If asked, print/sign POD for the vendor.
steps: Log into the Zebra device.
Select: 4. Goods Receipt › 1. DSD Receipt (with Reference).
Enter invoice details exactly as on the vendor invoice (invoice/PO #, vendor, date).
Press Enter to view the product list (orange screen).
Verify article codes, quantities, and expiries; adjust if needed.
Press F12 until the system confirms “Document is posted.”
If prompted, print and sign the Proof of Delivery (POD) and provide it to the vendor.
receiving.example: Use this for vendors like Coke/Pepsi, etc. Keep the signed invoice in the DSD Friday folder.

receiving.title: DC Receiving (Loblaw Trucks)
receiving.notes: Menu: 4 › Goods Receipt › 3. DC Receiving. Best practice: always verify pallet counts against the Stop Manifest; investigate yellow-list items.
steps: Log into the Zebra device.
Select: 4. Goods Receipt › 3. DC Receiving.
Scan the barcode label on each pallet.
After scanning all pallets, press F12 to check for unprocessed items.
Yellow list = pending/missing items; Grey = received. Investigate any yellow items (e.g., missing pallet).
Verify total pallet count against the Stop Manifest.
Escalate to the store manager/supervisor if discrepancies remain.
receiving.example: Scenario: A Loblaw truck delivers 5 pallets with barcodes—scan all 5, press F12, confirm everything greys out.

receiving.title: Proof of Delivery (POD)
receiving.notes: If you or the vendor needs a copy of the POD (Proof of Delivery), follow these steps on the desktop after receiving the document:
steps: After receiving the document, go to the **Store Page** on the desktop (after signing in to the SAP Portal).
Click **Reports** > **Order Management Reports** (on the left side arrow).
Select **Store Order Tracking**.
Enter the **PO Number** of the respective document (it always starts with 48...).
Click **Search**.
Once the list appears, click the **blue linked number** under the **GR DOCX** section.
At the top bar, choose **Print Version** and print the POD to the same receiving printer.

receiving.title: Check if Something Is Received or Not
receiving.notes: Use Store Order Tracking to confirm whether a PO has been received (goods receipt posted).
steps: On desktop, open **Store Page** (SAP Portal) and sign in.
Go to **Reports** → **Order Management Reports**.
Click **Store Order Tracking**.
In the search box, enter the **PO number** (DC POs start with 48...). Optionally set the date range.
Click **Search**.
If the PO is received, you will see a **blue linked number under GR DOCX** and a **GR Date**. Click the link to view details.
If there is **no GR DOCX link** (or it’s blank), the PO is **not yet received**.
receiving.example: PO 48XXXXXXXX shows a blue GR DOCX link and GR Date = received; no link = not received.

receiving.title: Find the PO Number for DSD Deliveries (When Not on Invoice)
receiving.notes: Some vendors, like **Jacent**, are received with reference but don’t list the PO number on the invoice. You can find the correct PO using the vendor number in SAP.
steps: On the **desktop**, open the **Store Page** (SAP Portal) and sign in.
Go to **Reports** → **Order Management Reports**.
Click **Store Order Tracking**.
In the search box, enter the **vendor number** and set the date range for the delivery day.
Click **Search**.
In the results, locate the most recent PO with that vendor number — the PO number will start with 48…
Use that PO number when performing **DSD Receipt (with Reference)** on the Zebra device.
receiving.example: Example: The Jacent invoice has no PO number. Open Store Order Tracking → search using Jacent’s vendor number → open the PO details → compare the **quantity** with the quantity listed on the invoice to confirm the correct PO → use that PO in DSD Receipt.
